player

Class LightTrail

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.LightTrail
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Property

    public class LightTrail
extends java.lang.Object
implements Property
    LightTrail is an impenetrable wall (for other players) which trails the player. A lightTrail cannot cover more than three squares and has to be updated every with every action the player performs. The each player is responsible for keeping his own lightTrail consistent with his actions. It is not allowed for a lightTrail to occupy the same position twice.
    Author:
    Bavo Mees

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightTrail

        public LightTrail(SquareContainer startSquare)
        Create a new lightTrail behind a player. The length of the newly created lightTrail will be zero.
        Parameters:
        startSquare - The start square.

    • Method Detail

      • updateLightTrail

        public void updateLightTrail(SquareContainer currentSquare)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Update the lightTrail to a specified coordinate. This method will trim the lightTrail if this appears to be necessary. When the method returns the lightTrail will cover a square with the specified coordinate if the previous length of the square was less than MAXIMUM LENGTH, otherwise the lightTrail will have shifted to cover the new Coordinate and the last coordinate of the square will be cleared of this lightTrail. This method should be called whenever the player makes a move action on the board.
        Parameters:
        currentSquare - the new square which the light trail should cover
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified coordinate is not a valid new coordinate for this lightTrail

      • isValidNewSquare

        public boolean isValidNewSquare(AbstractSquare currentSquare)
        Test whether a coordinate is valid as a new part of the light trail. This will return false if the lightTrail already contains the specified coordinate or if the specified coordinate is not a neighbor of the first coordinate of this lightTrail.
        Parameters:
        currentSquare - the square to test
        Returns:
        whether the new coordinate can be set as a new part of the lightTrail

      • updateLightTrail

        public void updateLightTrail()
        Update the lightTrail to a new state. When the method returns the lightTrail will not cover the last element of the previous lightTrail. This method should be called whenever the player executes an action that does not include moving around on the grid.

      • size

        public int size()
        returns the size of this lightTrail.
        Returns:
        the size of the lightTrail

      • getDecorator

        public AbstractSquareDecorator getDecorator(AbstractSquare square)

        Returns a Decorator that is wrapped around the specified square.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
